active_learning.discussion_prompt: How should risk reports differ when communicating to technical teams versus C-suite executives? Provide examples of what to include/exclude and why, considering stakeholder needs and potential misconceptions like oversimplifying technical risks for executives.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Pair students: One student explains the structure and key elements of a Cybersecurity Risk Register (CSRR) to their partner using NIST CSF examples; the partner teaches back by creating a simple CSRR entry for a hypothetical vulnerability (e.g., unpatched software).
active_learning.problem_solving: Real-world exercise: Given a scenario (e.g., a phishing campaign affecting the organization), students analyze risks using NIST CSF Tiers, populate a risk register, and draft a risk report recommending mitigations. Emphasize practical application and addressing misconceptions like ignoring likelihood vs. impact.
